column4: update-rc.d will remove the symlinks for you, but they come back in an upgrade.
isn't there away to just tell ubuntu _not_ to load a service without blowing it away?
I finally ended up writing a script that keeps a list of services I want turned off: it calls apt-get update, apt-get -f dist-upgrade, then update-rc.d for each disabled service.
sounds like the debian boot services standard needs some work
Yes, it does.  But debian people seem happy with it.  I don't know about rconf, that njan just mentioned, though.
The funny thing is: it's such a FAQ that debian has a bunch of pages about complicated-and-temporary ways to do it
